Posts.Content: nnoreen1221 wrote: Hi, My name is Nicole and my 74 year old grandmother recently found a mass in her right breast.  She immediately called her PCP and his diagnosis was that he was 90 %  sure this was breast Cancer.  No mammogram was done, but a biopsy will be done on Wednesday.  Please keep grandma Sara in your prayers, as well as everyone else.  This is a shock to the family and I do have to say that we have been blessed with a pretty healthily/no deaths in the family up until now.  SO I know as working in the medical field that anything can happen at any time, but the most important thing right now for my grandmother is great family support.  I live about 9 1/2 hours away from her and have my own family to take care of.  I did talk to my grandmother over the phone the other day and she sounded scared and had many fearful thoughts.  We also talked about me going to visit.  She advised me to to stay home and take care of my husband and two little boys (4 & 2.) My question is what can I do to stay positive and hold up for myself, family and grandmother.   This is the first discussion board that I have joined and I'm hoping that i will be able to gain strength and knowledge/awareness with Breast Cancer.  And I haven't mention but my mother is also watching a tumor in one of her breast, So i also believe that I have a change at developing cancer.... Sincerely, Nicole Log in to post a reply
